author: larsnelson
title: This Ice Tank polybag is unexpectedly good.
review:
I got this set on 2017-7-30 at a Target in Raleigh, NC for $3.99 for 71 parts. I was surprised by how interesting the set looked as I had not seen a review of it, yet. 

It is a neat little build that is very solid. At first, it leaves you guessing as to how it is going to come together. But when it is finished it is cleverly done and stable. I can imagine people using the base with the links as a way to MOC other little robot or military vehicles.

There are many parts that are nice because I did not have them in white or black, because I do not collect city sets. But the most important part is the Technic, Link chain in black (Item No: 3711) because it is somewhat hard to buy in quantity and the set comes with 31 of them.

I expect some people to buy this set just for the links.

The playability is fantastic. It rolls perfectly and the tracks stay on very tightly. It is hard to pull the tracks off. 

The value is great because it has the links, and for me some of the other parts were new. So much so, that I will buy more of them which is probably the best endorsement I can give it.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Zane's New Ride in Mini-Model Scale.
review:
Set #30427 Ice Tank: The LEGO Ninjago Movie is hitting hard with loads of sets and some great larger models reduced for Polybag scale. This little set has some great pros very little cons and will be a definite pick-up for fans and here’s why.

Pros:

  • Scale model looks beautiful, is very nicely designed and features some nice rare parts.

  • Real working treads.

  • Clear blue Astromech dome piece included.

  • Overall very fun to play with.

Cons:

  • Front cockpit section easy to dislodge during play and when handling.

Overall opinion

A must have Polybag, I love the look of it, the use of the LEGO tread pieces is a very welcome design choice, definitely recommended and don’t hesitate to get more if you’re looking for very useful parts.

author: vikings
title: Really Good Polybag
review:
Box/Instructions:

Comes in a polybag with normal polybag sized instructions. 

Parts:

You get a few cool parts in this set. You get a 2x2 trans blue brick and round brick and 30 black mini track pieces. The total piece count is 71. Overall a decent piece haul. 

The Build:

The build was quick and easy. It took me a few minutes to build. 

Overall Opinion:

Overall this is a really cool polybag. The design of it to incorporate the tracks into the build was really cool. The armor can fold apart which adds to the look. The cockpit looks really good and has a cannon on it. My only complaint is that the cockpit isn't very secure and comes off somewhat easily in play or when handling it. I do recommend this to any Lego collector. The design is great and getting a polybag with treads isn't very common. Overall I'm giving it a 4-star rating.

author: InvisibleTimmy
title: "I am not a robot, I am a wild teen!
review:
Note: This review may contain TLNM spoilers.

 

Build

The build is rather boring. 30 out of 71 pieces are tiny track links, so it's obviously very repetitive.

Completed

When the model is finished, though, it looks very good! The tan 3x3 cog wheels are snice touch as they allow you to roll the tank on low friction surfaces, but they do show a bit. Also problematic is the gap in the armor plates?

Parts

  • White angle plates (2x2 and 2x4)
  • Trans light blue 2x2 dome and round brick
  • 1x2 clear tile
  • The aforementioned 30 mini track links

Verdict 

A good set with room for improvement. 4/5
